net.antidot.api.search

Class TreeFacetValueHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.antidot.api.search.TreeFacetValueHelper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FacetValueHelperInterface

    public class TreeFacetValueHelper
extends java.lang.Object
implements FacetValueHelperInterface
    Represent one value of a facet. You can get access to main data such as: - key used to filter on specific facet value, - label for better integration than simple key, - count of documents defining the facet value, - sub-facet values for hierarchical facets.

      Retrieve the label of the facet value.

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        public java.lang.String getKey()
        Retrieve the key of the facet value. This key is used to filter on this specific facet value.
        Specified by:
        getKey in interface FacetValueHelperInterface
        Returns:
        key of the facet value.

      • getLabel

        public java.lang.String getLabel()
        Retrieve the label of the facet value. This label can be used instead of the @a key for a better web integration. If no label has been defined on PaF side, this method returns same result as @a getKey method.
        Specified by:
        getLabel in interface FacetValueHelperInterface
        Returns:
        label of the facet value.

      • getCount

        public long getCount()
        Retrieve number of documents which defines this specific facet value.
        Specified by:
        getCount in interface FacetValueHelperInterface
        Returns:
        number of documents defining this facet value.

      • getValues

        public java.util.List<FacetValueHelperInterface> getValues()
        List sub-values of this facet value. This list can be empty. See Antidot documentation to learn how to configure such facets.
        Specified by:
        getValues in interface FacetValueHelperInterface
        Returns:
        sub-values of the facet value.
